column2: The World's First Air-Line

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ capitalists have come together to create a joint venture unlike any before it: they call it an 'Air-Line' and they intend to trade under the name '$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Airship Travel Corporation'. They plan to deliver mail, goods, and passengers to destinations all around $COUNTRY$ and, hopefully, the world.
The famous $COUNTRY_ADJ$ spirit of enterprise!
Commercial Aviation
Since the birth of mechanical flight, our nation has taken a leading role in the production of airplanes. As such, a booming civil aviation industry has sprung up in $COUNTRY$.
Excellent!
The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line

Our country's rise as a major producer of steamships has been in part fuelled by the increasingly popular use of steam-powered ships to cross the Atlantic. In order to tap into that lucrative market, capitalists have come together in $COUNTRY$ and have founded a new transatlantic shipping line, the $COUNTRY$ Line.
May it sail forever!
$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line Wins Blue Riband!

A ship of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line, the SS $CAPITAL$, has won the Blue Riband, the prestigious award for the fastest crossing of the Atlantic! $COUNTRY$ has demonstrated to the world that it can produce ships of not only the most outstanding artistic quality, but also of the highest engineering standards.
Three hurrahs for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line!
Unsinkable Ship Launched!

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line has launched a new ship, christened Titanic due to her enormous size. She is the largest moving thing ever built by man! Not only that, but her innovative design makes her practically unsinkable, a fact that is sure to make her immensely profitable for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line. Soon she will be ready for her sea trials and will be able to make her maiden voyage across the Atlantic.
Well she doesn't look any bigger than the Mauretania.
Titanic Sinks With Huge Loss of Life!

A $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line ship, the Titanic, has sunk while crossing the Atlantic Ocean on her mayden voyage. The ship, the largest moving object in the world, was carying 2,208 passengers and crew when she struck an iceberg and sunk. 1,503 souls perished at the disaster, and experts are putting the blame on the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Line's top executives, who had not provided enough life boats for all passengers sailing on the Titanic, and on the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, which failed to pass adequate safety regulations. This has caused a global public outcry against irresponsible capitalism to erupt.
We must reform to avoid such a tragedy occuring again!
This was just a freak accident.
Ghosts of the Titanic

The aftermath of the Titanic disaster has created a wave of support for safety regulations in the developed world. The people are demanding such things of the government as not letting capitalists reap huge profits from shipping lines without first providing a bare minimum of safety for the passengers.
We must reform to avoid such a tragedy occuring again!
This was just a freak accident.
Preventing Another Titanic

The powerful pro-regulation lobby created in the aftermath of the deadly Titanic disaster has achieved its goals, ensuring world-class safety standards in $COUNTRY$. Ships, trains, airplanes, automobiles, and everything else, is safer as a result.
It was the right thing to do.
An Underground Railway

Overcrowding in $CAPITAL$ has forced some of $COUNTRY$'s brightest minds to propose a radical transport solution: the construction of an underground railway beneath $CAPITAL$, linking major parts of the capital without congesting the streets above. Such an undertaking has never before been taken on, and there are serious doubts about whether such a transport system is viable or, indeed, even possible. Two things are for certain though, that it is going to be very expensive and that the overcrowding in the streets of $CAPITAL$ is becoming a major issue.
Exceptional problems call for exceptional solutions.
Underground trains? Ludicrous.
The $PROVINCE$ Metropolitan Railway

Construction of the underground railway in $PROVINCE$ has finished, and what is now known as the $PROVINCE$ Metropolitan Railway has officially opened to commercial use. Though at the moment the system only runs a single line, it is expected that more lines will be constructed in due course due to the high demand which has been observed.
Choo choooooo!
Railway Troubles in $PROVINCE$

The construction of the underground railway in $PROVINCE$ has ran into financial and engineering difficulties, with contractors indicating that the completion will have to be pushed back for months. In a particularly scathing critique of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, they blamed the government's haphazard and half-hearted support of a complex project such as this.
They better have it ready in time!
The $CAPITAL$ Underground Railway

When $COUNTRY_ADJ$ engineers suggested a few years prior that the solution to $CAPITAL$'s street congestion was the construction of an underground railway line snaking beneath the crowded streets, many questioned whether such a railway was possible. Not so today, however, as the $CAPITAL$ Metropolitan Railway, commonly known as 'the Underground' or 'the Tube', opened its doors to paying passengers. $COUNTRY$ has showcased to the world both its engineering prowess, as well as its innovative thinking.
Underground railways? Whatever next?
A Metropolitan Railway for $PROVINCE$

Now that the use of underground railway systems has been proven to be an effective solution to street congestion in large cities, it has been suggested that we construct a Metropolitan Railway system in $PROVINCE$. This is expected to cost, but the pros are sure to outweigh the cons.
We shall fund such a project
This is a frivolous expense
